segment.source: OperatingSystem - Application Report (Windows 10)
segment.target: OperatingSystem - Application Report (Windows 10)

segment.source: This section describes the compatibility reports in Application Compatibility Manager (ACM) and how you can work with the reports.
segment.target: This section describes the compatibility reports in Application Compatibility Manager (ACM) and how you can work with the reports.

segment.source: OperatingSystem - Application Report
segment.target: OperatingSystem - Application Report

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Windows 8
segment.target: Windows 8

segment.source: Windows 7
segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2012
segment.target: Windows Server 2012

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2

segment.source: This section describes the compatibility reports in Application Compatibility Manager (ACM) and how you can work with the reports.
segment.target: This section describes the compatibility reports in Application Compatibility Manager (ACM) and how you can work with the reports.

segment.source: The OperatingSystem - Application Report screen shows the following information for the applications from which you have collected data:
segment.target: The OperatingSystem - Application Report screen shows the following information for the applications from which you have collected data:

segment.source: The application name, application vendor, and application version.
segment.target: The application name, application vendor, and application version.

segment.source: Your organization’s compatibility rating for the application.
segment.target: Your organization’s compatibility rating for the application.

segment.source: Compatibility ratings from users in your organization who are using a runtime analysis package to test the application.
segment.target: Compatibility ratings from users in your organization who are using a runtime analysis package to test the application.

segment.source: Whether the information for the application is included in the synchronization process with the Microsoft Compatibility Exchange.
segment.target: Whether the information for the application is included in the synchronization process with the Microsoft Compatibility Exchange.

segment.source: Compatibility information for the application from the application vendor.
segment.target: Compatibility information for the application from the application vendor.

segment.source: Compatibility ratings from the ACT Community, if you are a member of the ACT Community.
segment.target: Compatibility ratings from the ACT Community, if you are a member of the ACT Community.

segment.source: To join the ACT Community, see Settings Dialog Box - Preferences Tab.
segment.target: To join the ACT Community, see Settings Dialog Box - Preferences Tab.

segment.source: The count of active issues for the application.
segment.target: The count of active issues for the application.

segment.source: The count of computers in your organization on which the application is installed.
segment.target: The count of computers in your organization on which the application is installed.

segment.source: To open the OperatingSystem - Application Report screen
segment.target: To open the OperatingSystem - Application Report screen

segment.source: In ACM, on the Quick Reports pane, click Analyze.
segment.target: In ACM, on the Quick Reports pane, click Analyze.

segment.source: In the Quick Reports pane, under an operating system heading, click Applications.
segment.target: In the Quick Reports pane, under an operating system heading, click Applications.

segment.source: Using the OperatingSystem - Application Report Screen
segment.target: Using the OperatingSystem - Application Report Screen

segment.source: On the OperatingSystem - Application Report screen, you can perform the following actions:
segment.target: On the OperatingSystem - Application Report screen, you can perform the following actions:

segment.source: Export the report data to a spreadsheet, or import a report.
segment.target: Export the report data to a spreadsheet, or import a report.

segment.source: For more information, see Saving, Opening, and Exporting Reports.
segment.target: For more information, see Saving, Opening, and Exporting Reports.

segment.source: Choose whether to synchronize data for each application with the Microsoft Compatibility Exchange.
segment.target: Choose whether to synchronize data for each application with the Microsoft Compatibility Exchange.

segment.source: For more information, see Selecting the Send and Receive Status for an Application.
segment.target: For more information, see Selecting the Send and Receive Status for an Application.

segment.source: Synchronize your compatibility issues by using the Microsoft Compatibility Exchange.
segment.target: Synchronize your compatibility issues by using the Microsoft Compatibility Exchange.

segment.source: For more information, see Sending and Receiving Compatibility Data.
segment.target: For more information, see Sending and Receiving Compatibility Data.

segment.source: Filter the report by using the query builder.
segment.target: Filter the report by using the query builder.

segment.source: For more information, see Filtering Your Compatibility Data.
segment.target: For more information, see Filtering Your Compatibility Data.

segment.source: Select your compatibility rating for an application.
segment.target: Select your compatibility rating for an application.

segment.source: For more information, see Selecting Your Compatibility Rating.
segment.target: For more information, see Selecting Your Compatibility Rating.

segment.source: Select your deployment status for an application.
segment.target: Select your deployment status for an application.

segment.source: For more information, see Selecting Your Deployment Status.
segment.target: For more information, see Selecting Your Deployment Status.

segment.source: Assign categories and subcategories to an application.
segment.target: Assign categories and subcategories to an application.

segment.source: For more information, see Categorizing Your Compatibility Data.
segment.target: For more information, see Categorizing Your Compatibility Data.

segment.source: Specify the importance of an application to your organization.
segment.target: Specify the importance of an application to your organization.

segment.source: For more information, see Prioritizing Your Compatibility Data.
segment.target: For more information, see Prioritizing Your Compatibility Data.

segment.source: Double-click an application name to view the associated dialog box.
segment.target: Double-click an application name to view the associated dialog box.

segment.source: For more information, see Application Dialog Box.
segment.target: For more information, see Application Dialog Box.
